page.title: 20 PEOPLE OF ASTWICK
page.content: At the time of William 1st's Domesday Survey there were 12 men living in Aswick.Now the population is between 35 and 40.13 of them go to church.25 of them are on the electoral roll. The Kitchiners have been tenants at Church Farm for 100 years.In the Old Rectory Miss.P.Davis belongs to a family connected with Astwick for over a hundred years.And at Bury Farm,the Struthers came from Scotland 50 years ago.Other families have moved there more recently. Mrs Kitchiner whos family have farmed at{Church Farm}for{100 years} says she likes living in Astwick because "{it is nice and peaceful and {very}enjoyable " Sara and Verity
